func (r *router) handle(ctx *Context) {

package linkedlist

import "fmt"

/// Linked List in Golang

// Linked List Data Structure

type node struct {
	data interface{}
	next *node
}
func newLinkNode(data interface{}) *node{
	return &node{
		data : data,
		next : nil,
	}
}

type LinkedList struct {
	head  *node
	size  uint
}
// NewLinkedList create a linked list
func NewLinkedList() *LinkedList {
	return &LinkedList{
		head : nil,
		size: 0,
	}
}


/// Public function of linked list

// Len get the linked list length
func (list *LinkedList) Len() uint {
	return list.size
}

// Insert insert on the head of the linked list
func (list *LinkedList) Insert(data int) *LinkedList {
	newNode := newLinkNode(data)
	newNode.next = list.head
	list.head = newNode
	list.size+=1
	return list
}

// RemoveHead delete head node at the linked list
func (list *LinkedList) RemoveHead(){
	if list.head == nil{
		return
	}
	list.head = list.head.next
	list.size-=1
}

// RemoveItem delete the n node
func (list *LinkedList) RemoveItem(n *node) {
	if n == nil {
		return
	}
	if n == list.head {
		list.RemoveHead()
		return
	}
	cur := list.head
	for cur.next != nil {
		if cur.next == n {
			cur.next = cur.next.next
			list.size-=1
			return
		}
		cur = cur.next
	}
}

// Find find the node
func (list *LinkedList) Find(data int) *node {
	if list.head == nil{
		return nil
	}
	cur := list.head
	for cur != nil{
		if cur.data == data{
			return cur
		}
		cur = cur.next
	}
	return nil
}

// Head get the head node
func (list *LinkedList) Head() *node {
	return list.head
}

// Print print the linked list
func (list *LinkedList) Print() string {
	var format string
	cur := list.head
	for cur != nil {
		format += fmt.Sprintf("%+v", cur.data)
		cur = cur.next
		if cur != nil {
			format += "->"
		}
	}
	// fmt.Println(format)
	return format
}

/// Array in Golang

// Array Data Structure
type array struct {
Â  Â  data Â  []int
Â  Â  length uint
}

// NewArray create a array
func NewArray(capacity uint) *array {
Â  Â  if capacity == 0 {
Â  Â  Â  Â  return nil
Â  Â  }
Â  Â  return &array{
Â  Â  Â  Â  data: Â  make([]int, capacity),
Â  Â  Â  Â  length: 0,
Â  Â  }
}

/// Public function of array

// Len get the array length
func (arr *array) Len() uint {
Â  Â  return arr.length
}

// Insert insert the value at the index
func (arr *array) Insert(val int, ind uint) (*array, error) {
Â  Â  if arr.isIndexOutOfRange(ind) {
Â  Â  Â  Â  return nil, fmt.Errorf("out of range")
Â  Â  }
Â  Â  if arr.Len() == uint(cap(arr.data)) {
Â  Â  Â  Â  return nil, fmt.Errorf("full array")
Â  Â  }
Â  Â  for i := arr.Len(); i > ind; i-- {
Â  Â  Â  Â  arr.data[i] = arr.data[i-1]
Â  Â  }
Â  Â  arr.data[ind] = val
Â  Â  arr.length++
Â  Â  return arr, nil
}

// Delete delete the value at the index
func (arr *array) Delete(ind uint) (*array, error) {
Â  Â  if arr.isIndexOutOfRange(ind) {
Â  Â  Â  Â  return nil, fmt.Errorf("out of range")
Â  Â  }
Â  Â  for i := ind; i < arr.Len()-1; i++ {
Â  Â  Â  Â  arr.data[i] = arr.data[i+1]
Â  Â  }
Â  Â  arr.length--
Â  Â  return arr, nil
}

// Find find the value at the index
func (arr *array) Find(ind uint) (int, error) {
Â  Â  if arr.isIndexOutOfRange(ind) {
Â  Â  Â  Â  return 0, fmt.Errorf("out of range")
Â  Â  }
Â  Â  return arr.data[ind], nil
}

// Print print the array
func (arr *array) Print(){
Â  Â  var format string
Â  Â  for i := uint(0); i < arr.Len(); i++ {
Â  Â  Â  Â  format += fmt.Sprintf("|%+v", arr.data[i])
Â  Â  }
Â  Â  fmt.Println(format)
}


/// Private function of array

// isIndexOutOfRange check if the index is out of range
func (arr *array) isIndexOutOfRange(index uint) bool {
Â  Â  return index >= uint(cap(arr.data))
}

// BobbleSort bobble sort
func (arr *array) Bobble() {
 if arr.Len() <= 1 {
  return
 }
 for i := uint(0); i < arr.Len(); i++ {
  for j := uint(0); j < arr.Len()-i-1; j++ {
   if arr.data[j] > arr.data[j+1] {
    arr.data[j], arr.data[j+1] = arr.data[j+1], arr.data[j]
   }
  }
 }
}

// BinarySearch
func (arr *array) BinarySearch(tar int) int {
 var (
  low  = 0
  high = int(arr.Len()) - 1
 )
 for low <= high {
  mid := low + (high-low)/2
  if arr.data[mid] > tar {
   high = mid - 1
  }else if arr.data[mid] < tar {
   low = mid + 1
  }else{
   return mid
  }
 }
 return -1
}
